meanings.definition: A small piece of stiff paper or plastic used to write on or for playing games.
meanings.sent1: I wrote my name on a card for my friend's birthday.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out cards for the students to use during the game.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sat on my card during the game and squished it!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright, colorful card in a sea of gray.
meanings.sent5: The card fluttered to the ground, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A flat, rectangular piece of stiff paper with information printed on it.
meanings.sent1: I found a card with a map of the city at the tourist information center.
meanings.sent2: The business card had the company's logo and contact details.
meanings.sent3: The card with the recipe on it got mixed up with the shopping list!
meanings.sent4: His words hit me like a business card, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The card with the emergency numbers was always kept on the fridge.

meanings.definition: To clean (wool or cotton) with a carding instrument.
meanings.sent1: She carefully carded the wool to prepare it for spinning.
meanings.sent2: The old lady showed me how to card the cotton to make it soft.
meanings.sent3: I carded the wool so vigorously that it flew everywhere like confetti!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to card through my thoughts, leaving them clear and organized.
meanings.sent5: The wind carded through the fields, bending the tall grass in waves.
